title: League perception is at a cataclysmic low.
body:
No one wants to see anything that doesn't fit in their narrow, microscopic worldview, and all the vision in the universe won't fix it. League players have simply nerfed themselves into absolute oblivion.

In my previous game, I ended up being Vayne. I am normally not the ADC, but I wanted to try out how a Triforce works on her (it does), and sheer improbability gave me the ADC role when I selected fill.

I walked away from the game with a four-man report for intentionally feeding. Why? Because the enemy had some extreme vendetta against me or something, and they were flash tower diving me AT LEVEL 1 to try and force me out of the lane. When the lanes opened up, I'd get hyperfocused no matter where I was, no matter how far back I was, and nobody would help or even see that I was getting focused. I'd try to engage the enemy after the team does, the enemy would drop everything and flash ult me, even when it culminated in their own deaths. I'd stick behind the team, VERY far behind the team, and the enemy would just flash ult to kill me right past them, and nobody would see it.

It's not like I was quiet about it, either. I warned them that they were focusing me, and literally no one saw it. Then they turned around and blamed me for making them lose.

Is this what League has become, where no one sees anything ever? I ping constantly, ward constantly, and try to rally everyone to push objectives constantly, and no one ever sees anything. Imperception is killing the game, and this isn't something Riot can just patch. When players block out absolutely everything around them to the point of sensory deprivation...

There's no words to describe it. Players are intentionally destroying themselves to... what? What benefit could you POSSIBLY gain from turning a blind eye to absolutely everything in the game?!

replies.body:
You are lying. I dont know why. But i am watching replay of your game atm. Noone flash dived u at lvl 1. Your Kindred ganked when u were lvl 3 and u didnt move a bit to help and he died. First time u died was at minute 6:30 from Malzahar after u killed Ashe. And that death was your fault, u took minion aggro and u tunneled ashe, ignoring Malzahar, instead of letting Kindred finish Ashe and backing off. Then at minute 10 u overextended to get 1 ranged minion and u got caught in Malzahars ultimate and Ashe ultimate. Then at minute 13 u moved away  from your team on 30% hp and walked into river for no reason. Leblanc killed u.  And u constantly went bot and bot and bot. And constantly died there. Also your positioning was bad, you werent "far behind your team" , every time u tumbled into enemy team. U were practically in melee range every fight. At minute your team was positioned behind your blue buff camp, ready to contest baron if enemy team engages. U walked past your team and facechecked bush. Leblanc was there, you survive on 10% hp, and your team lost 4v5 fight cause u had to run. And again at minute 31 u tumbled into enemy team and died.

I agree you didnt intentionally feed, you didnt break any rules, but you played horribly. Not your build but your gameplay. I understand your teams frustration.

Man oh man
If you talk like you type, you are never getting laid buddy
Seems normal. It's like how I talk o,o

That four man report for int feed is going to get you banned. This game got me banned- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kQn6Zrji9V4

I have been reported en masse for years now for baseless claims, probably a hell of a lot more than you have; I haven't been punished once because they've never held water. Everyone reports everyone for even the tiniest things in this accursed game, and if you abuse the system like that, it has a crying wolf effect, something nobody knows about, let alone understands.

But otherwise yeah you fed. No its not reportable its just something that sometimes happens if you get caught out enough.
You just got unlucky. Had a ranked game where I was in a similar place but I didn't get reported cuz my team knew I couldn't do anything. So, not everyone is like that
